body.head: Joseph Cornell
body.octave:
Into a sweeping meticulously- detailed disaster the violet light pours. It's not a sky it's a room. And in the open field a glass of absinthe is fluttering its song of Inida. Prairie winds circle mosques.
You are always a little too
body.sestet: young to understand. He is bored with his sense of the past, the artist. Out of the prescient rock in his heart he has spread a land without flowers of near distances.
